basics.name: David Kirwan
basics.label: Cloud Operations Engineer
basics.summary:
Hi my name is David Kirwan, I am a recent computing postgraduate from the Waterford Institute of Technology, and currently based in Waterford City, Ireland. I am an avid supporter of open source software / hardware and I have huge interest in STEM/STEAM(A - Art) fields in general. I'm particularly Interested in the maker movement, where I enjoy building interactive prototypes using embedded system such as Arduino and Raspberry Pi. I'm a member of the local makerspace the South East Makerspace (SEMS) and have been involved in several projects. See the [[b;#ffffff;#000]projects] command for a list of my projects.

Time permitting, I also like to get involved in amateur astronomy and amateur radio. I maintain a 20.1MHz dual dipole antenna array and software defined radio receiver. I passed my CEPT Class 2 amateur radio licence exam in 2017 (callsign: EI-7HTB). In the near future I hope to pursue a Ph.D program in an Astronomy/Computing field.

work.summary: As Cloud Operations Engineer at Red Hat Mobile (FeedHenry acquired by Red Hat in October 2014), our team is responsible for a portfolio of global cloud infrastructure that powers our hosted mobile apps platform. This includes the management, administration, monitoring, security and scalability of the platform, as well as participating and innovating within the DevOps and Continuous Integration ethos therein.
highlights: Responsible for the rollout of new versions of the Red Hat Mobile Application Platform.
Involved in the Network Operations Center

work.summary: TSSG is an internationally recognised centre of excellence for ICT research and innovation. We carry out a wide spectrum of industry-informed research in Information and Communications Technologies (ICT), particularly technologies enabling communications and information services.
highlights: Network QoS and Optimisation on Enterprise Ireland funded research project.
Energy Demand/Dispatch Optimisation for charging electric vehicles as part of EU funded FP7 FINESCE project.
